var Aggregate that calculates the sample variance.

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: The var aggregate returns the sample variance of a set of values. You can optionally specify one or more dimensions to group by.

The sample variance of an empty set is NULL. The sample variance of a set that contains only NULL values is also NULL. If the set contains NULL and NOT NULL values, the var aggregate considers only NOT NULL values.

informalexample.para: This example finds the variance of every column of a 3Ã—3 array.

step.para:
Create an array:
AQL% CREATE ARRAY m3x3<val:double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0];

Put random values between 1 and 9 into m3x3:
AFL% store(build(m3x3,random()%10/1.0),m3x3);
     [
[(1),(2),(2)],
[(2),(9),(0)],
[(2),(0),(0)]
]

Find the variance for each column of m3x3:
AFL% aggregate(m3x3,var(val),j) [(0.333333),(22.3333),(1.33333)]
